abstract.text: Learn how to determine a user’s risk of exposure.

metadata.title: Exposure Risk Value Calculation in ExposureNotification Version 1

inlineContent.text: The ExposureNotification framework uses an Exposure Risk Value to assist the user in determining whether they may have been exposed to the coronavirus. Health authorities have flexibility in calculating this value by setting weights and values in a configuration object.
To adopt this method of risk assessment, set the
key to the integer value
in the app’s
The following diagram illustrates the data structure and formula used to calculate the Exposure Risk Value.
The following parameters are used to calculate a risk for each exposure incident:

Transmission risk is intended to reflect the status of infection in the affected user and its effect on risk of transmission. The value is based on the affected user’s symptoms, when symptoms first appeared, level of diagnosis verification, or other determination from the app or a health authority.
Transmission Risk
Cumulative duration of the exposure. The framework measures this value.
Duration
Days since the exposure incident. The framework measures this value.
Days
The attenuation (

) can vary during an exposure event. Attenuation values greater than 0 are weighted by the duration at each risk level and averaged for the overall duration. The framework measures and calculates this value.
Attenuation
The
is calculated using the following formula:
Level values are in the range of 0-8. While the formula’s range can be up to 4096, the framework limits
to the upper limit of
, which has a maximum value of 255.
The following diagram illustrates an example of an Exposure Risk Value calculated for a person who was exposed to another person who was diagnosed positive.

For this example, the other user reported a positive diagnosis, the encounter between the two devices lasted 14 minutes, it happened 4 days ago, and the signal strength attenuation between their phones had a weighted average of 68. The
is limited and set to 255.
To exclude exposure incidents with a risk score below a certain amount, set
. The framework doesn’t use this property when calculating

abstract.text: Implement a COVID-19 exposure notification system that protects user privacy.
The object that contains parameters for configuring exposure notification risk scoring behavior.
The configurable signal-loss thresholds for calculating exposure risk.
The level values for attenuation.
The weight assigned to a score for the Bluetooth signal strength.
The level values for days since last exposure.
The number of days to consider when calculating the risk level.
The weight assigned to a score for the days since the user’s exposure.
The level values for duration.
The weight assigned to a score for the duration of the user’s exposure.
The metadata you use to configure the exposure calculations.
The value that is the user’s minimum risk score.
The value that is the user’s full-range minimum risk score.
The level values for transmission risk.
The weight assigned to a score for the affected user’s estimated risk of transmission.
The number of keys that matched for an exposure detection.
The incident information related to a potential exposure.
The value that represents the total risk score the framework calculates for this exposure incident.
The user’s estimated risk of exposure.
The value associated with a particular risk level.
A value signifying the risk of an exposure event.
